questions.question: Which parable features a Wealthy Landowning Father, an Older Son, and a Younger Son? (2 possible answers)

choices.answer: The parable of the tenants
The parable of the prodigal son
The parable of the lost sons
the parable of the workers

questions.question: In the parable of the lost sons, the Father represents God. Who does the Younger son represent? (Choose 2)

choices.answer: Only the bad people - those who ignore and rebel against God
In a way, the younger son represents all people, because we all ignore God
People whose rebellion against God is more obvious and outward
All of the above

questions.question: Who does the Older son represent?

choices.answer: People whose rebellion against God is more subtle and inward
In a way, all of us, when we value 'things' above our relationship with God
All of us - our attitude to God can often be very unloving and dishonouring
All of the above

questions.question: What else can we learn from the Older son?

choices.answer: We should never obey God in an attempt to 'earn' God's love or favour
We should never think we are 'better' than those who ignore God more openly
We should celebrate God's mercy & forgiveness towards those who ask for it
We serve God in our daily lives if our service is motivated by love for God

questions.question: What is the massive meaning (or main message) of this parable? (Choose 2)...

choices.answer: We are all guilty of ignoring and rebelling against God, in various ways
Don't bother trying to serve God, he doesn't care how we live
God prefers our sin to obvious & outward, not inward & subtle
God loves us so much and will 100% forgive us if we genuinely ask him to
